info.title: mapguide-rest
info.description:
mapguide-rest provides a REST API for MapGuide Open Source and Autodesk Infrastructure Map Server
NOTE: Basic HTTP authentication credentials will generally be cached by the web browser for a short period should you choose to use this method instead of passing in session ids

get.summary: Returns the base library name for this coordinate system library

post.summary: Checks if the given coordinate system WKT string is valid
Converts the given Coordinate System WKT string to its equivalent EPSG code
Converts the given Coordinate System WKT string to its equivalent CS-Map coordinate system code

get.summary: Enumerates coordinate system categories and returns the result in the desired format
Enumerates coordinate systems under the specified category
Converts the given CS-Map coordinate system code to EPSG
Converts the given CS-Map coordinate system code to WKT
Converts the given EPSG code to its CS-Map coordinate system code
Converts the given EPSG code to WKT
Enumerates all data configurations
Gets the data configuration for the given URI part

post.summary: Set the given data configuration

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The data configuration file to load

get.summary: Gets the list of files for the given data configuration

post.summary: Upload a file for a given data configuration

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: The file name to upload to

delete.summary: Deletes a file for a given data configuration

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: The file name to upload to

get.summary: Tests the connection status of a feature source

parameters.name: resourcePath
parameters.description: The path of the resource ID

get.summary: Gets long transactions of a feature source

parameters.description: The path of the resource ID

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Return only active long transactions if true, otherwise returns all long transactions

get.summary: Gets the schema names of a feature source

parameters.name: resourcePath
parameters.description: The path of the resource ID

get.summary: Gets the full description of the specified schema

parameters.name: resourcePath
parameters.description: The path of the resource ID

parameters.name: classnames
parameters.description: The dot-separated list of class names

get.summary: Gets the class names of the given schema for a feature source

parameters.name: resourcePath
parameters.description: The path of the resource ID

get.summary: Gets a class definition of the specified name from the feature source

parameters.name: resourcePath
parameters.description: The path of the resource ID

get.summary: Gets a class definition of the specified name from the feature source

parameters.name: resourcePath
parameters.description: The path of the resource ID

get.summary: Queries features from the specified feature source

parameters.name: resourcePath
parameters.description: The path of the resource ID

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of proprety names

parameters.name: maxfeatures
parameters.description: The maximum number of features to restrict this response to

parameters.name: transformto
parameters.description: The CS-Map coordinate system code to transform the resulting features into

parameters.name: bbox
parameters.description: A comma-separated quartet (x1,y1,x2,y2) defining the spatial filter geometry

parameters.name: bboxistargetcs
parameters.description: Indicates if the bbox should be interpreted in the coordinate system specified in the transformto parameter

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of property names

parameters.name: pagesize
parameters.description: Applies pagination on the query result. This specifies the number of results for the page.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Applies pagination on the query result. This specifies the page number of the page. You must specify a valid page size value (> 0) for this parameter to apply.

put.summary: Updates one or more features into the given feature class for the specified feature source. The Feature Source in question must have _MgRestAllowUpdate=1 in its resource header otherwise updates will be forbidden. If _MgRestUseTransaction=1 in the resource header, transactions will be used.

parameters.name: resourcePath
parameters.description: The path of the resource ID

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The XML envelope describing the features to be update

post.summary: Inserts one or more features into the given feature class for the specified feature source. The Feature Source in question must have _MgRestAllowInsert=1 in its resource header otherwise inserts will be forbidden. If _MgRestUseTransaction=1 in the resource header, transactions will be used.

parameters.name: resourcePath
parameters.description: The path of the resource ID

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The Feature Set XML describing the features to be inserted

get.summary: Queries features from the specified layer definition. Any hyperlink, tooltip and elevation expressions in the Layer Definition will be computed and returned in the response

parameters.name: resourcePath
parameters.description: The path of the resource ID

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of proprety names

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The FDO filter to apply. This will be combined with whatever filter is defined in the layer

parameters.name: maxfeatures
parameters.description: The maximum number of features to restrict this response to

parameters.name: transformto
parameters.description: The CS-Map coordinate system code to transform the resulting features into

parameters.name: bbox
parameters.description: A comma-separated quartet (x1,y1,x2,y2) defining the spatial filter geometry

parameters.name: bboxistargetcs
parameters.description: Indicates if the bbox should be interpreted in the coordinate system specified in the transformto parameter

parameters.name: pagesize
parameters.description: Applies pagination on the query result. This specifies the number of results for the page. You cannot specify this parameter for CZML output

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Applies pagination on the query result. This specifies the page number of the page. You must specify a valid page size value (> 0) for this parameter to apply. You cannot specify this parameter for CZML output

get.summary: Queries features from the specified feature source

parameters.name: resourcePath
parameters.description: The path of the resource ID

parameters.name: property
parameters.description: The property name to get distinct values of. Only applies if aggregate type is 'distinctvalues'

parameters.name: depth

parameters.description: The path of the Layer Definition

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description: The scale at which the symbolization is requested

parameters.name: themecat
parameters.description: The value indicating which theme category swatch to return. Used when there is a theme defined at this scale

parameters.name: width

parameters.description: The Y coordinate of the map center to plot

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title to put in the plot

get.summary: Gets the KML for the specified map definition

parameters.name: resourcePath
parameters.description: The path of the Map Definition

parameters.name: native
parameters.description: If true, this operation will simply pass through to the mapagent. This is much faster, but note that all network link URLs will be referring to the mapagent instead of downstream RESTful layer KML URLs.

get.summary: Gets the KML for the specified layer definition

parameters.name: resourcePath
parameters.description: The path of the Layer Definition

parameters.name: bbox
parameters.description: A comma-separated quartet (x1,y1,x2,y2) defining the spatial filter geometry. Coordinates must be LL84 coordinates

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The display width of the KML viewport

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The display height of the KML viewport

parameters.name: draworder
parameters.description: The draw order of this layer

get.summary: Gets the features KML for the specified layer definition

parameters.name: resourcePath
parameters.description: The path of the Layer Definition

parameters.name: bbox
parameters.description: A comma-separated quartet (x1,y1,x2,y2) defining the spatial filter geometry. Coordinates must be LL84 coordinates

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The display width of the KML viewport

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The display height of the KML viewport

parameters.name: draworder
parameters.description: The draw order of this layer

get.summary: Gets all registered FDO providers
Gets the capabilities of the given FDO provider
Enumerates the available data stores for this provider with the current connection string
Enumerates the available values for a given connection property.
Enumerates available templates for a fusion application
Enumerates available widgets for a fusion application
Enumerates available containers for a fusion application

post.summary: Enumerates files in an unmanaged aliased directory

get.summary: Gets schema mapping of a feature source

post.summary: Copies a resource from one resource ID to another

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: Indicates whether to overwrite the target resource if it exists

post.summary: Moves a resource from one resource ID to another

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: Indicates whether to overwrite the target resource if it exists

parameters.name: cascade
parameters.description: Indicates whether to cascade any reference changes in related documents as a result of this change

post.summary: Transforms the given coordinates from the specified source coordinate system to the target coordinate system

parameters.name: coords
parameters.description: A comma-delimited list of space-delimited coordinate pairs

post.summary: Creates a new Runtime Map (MgMap) instance from the specified map definition and returns detailed information about its layer/group structure if requested

parameters.name: session
parameters.description: Your MapGuide Session ID. If none specified you must pass the basic http authentication challenge

parameters.name: mapdefinition
parameters.description: The Map Definition ID to create a new runtime map from

parameters.name: targetmapname
parameters.description: The target map name to associate the Runtime Map by. By default, the name is generated from the Map Definition ID

parameters.name: requestedfeatures
parameters.description: A bitmask of the information about the Runtime Map that you would like returned. 1=Layer/Group structure, 2=icons, 4=Feature Source Information

parameters.name: iconformat
parameters.description: The desired icon image format if icons are requested

parameters.name: iconwidth
parameters.description: The desired width of generated icons if icons are requested

parameters.name: iconheight
parameters.description: The desired height of generated icons if icons are requested

parameters.name: iconsperscalerange
parameters.description: The number of icons to generate per scale range if icons are requested

post.summary: Creates a new MapGuide session

get.summary: Gets the session timeout of the specified session
Renders an image of the specified runtime map. Will also modify the map's state based on the parameters you specify

parameters.name: mapName
parameters.description: The name of the runtime map

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The X coordinate of the map center to render

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The Y coordinate of the map center to render

parameters.name: keepselection
parameters.description: Indicates whether any selection should be retained

parameters.name: dpi
parameters.description: The display DPI. If not specified, defaults to 96

parameters.name: showlayers
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of layer object ids

parameters.name: showgroups
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of layer group ids

parameters.name: hidelayers
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of layer object ids

parameters.name: hidegroups
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of layer group ids

get.summary: Renders a dynamic overlay image of the specified runtime map. Will also modify the map's state based on the parameters you specify

parameters.name: mapName
parameters.description: The name of the runtime map

parameters.name: selectioncolor
parameters.description: The selection color as HTML color string

parameters.name: behavior
parameters.description: A bitmask controlling rendering behavior. 1=Render Selection, 2=Render layers, 4=Keep Selection, 8=Render Base Layers (only for MapGuide Open Source 2.5 and above)

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The X coordinate of the map center to render

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The Y coordinate of the map center to render

parameters.name: keepselection
parameters.description: Indicates whether any selection should be retained

parameters.name: dpi
parameters.description: The display DPI. If not specified, defaults to 96

parameters.name: showlayers
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of layer object ids

parameters.name: showgroups
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of layer group ids

parameters.name: hidelayers
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of layer object ids

parameters.name: hidegroups
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of layer group ids

get.summary: Renders a legend image of the specified runtime map

parameters.name: mapName
parameters.description: The name of the runtime map

get.summary: Gets the layers of the specified runtime map

parameters.name: mapName
parameters.description: The name of the runtime map

parameters.name: requestedfeatures
parameters.description: A bitmask of the additional information that you would like returned. 2=icons, 4=Feature Source Information

parameters.name: iconformat
parameters.description: The desired icon image format if icons are requested

parameters.name: iconwidth
parameters.description: The desired width of generated icons if icons are requested

parameters.name: iconheight
parameters.description: The desired height of generated icons if icons are requested

parameters.name: iconsperscalerange
parameters.description: The number of icons to generate per scale range if icons are requested

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: Only return layers belonging to the specified group

get.summary: Gets the layer groups of the specified runtime map

parameters.name: mapName
parameters.description: The name of the runtime map

get.summary: Plot the map to the specified type using the center and scale from the map

parameters.name: mapName
parameters.description: The name of the runtime map

parameters.name: printlayout
parameters.description: The PrintLayout resource to use for plotting. Only applies if plotting to DWF

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title to put in the plot

parameters.name: layeredpdf
parameters.description: Indicates whether to produce a layered PDF. Only applies if plotting PDFs. This is slower than regular PDF plot, but produces a PDF with the same layer structure as the map

get.summary: Describe an existing MgMap instance from the specified mapname and session id and returns detailed information about its layer/group structure if requested

parameters.name: session
parameters.description: Your MapGuide Session ID. If none specified you must pass the basic http authentication challenge

parameters.name: mapName
parameters.description: The map name used to identify the MgMap instance

parameters.name: requestedfeatures
parameters.description: A bitmask of the information about the Runtime Map that you would like returned. 1=Layer/Group structure, 2=icons, 4=Feature Source Information

parameters.name: iconformat
parameters.description: The desired icon image format if icons are requested

parameters.name: iconwidth
parameters.description: The desired width of generated icons if icons are requested

parameters.name: iconheight
parameters.description: The desired height of generated icons if icons are requested

parameters.name: iconsperscalerange
parameters.description: The number of icons to generate per scale range if icons are requested

get.summary: Update the layers and groups of the runtime map

parameters.name: mapName
parameters.description: The name of the runtime map

get.summary: Gets the selection XML of the given map

parameters.name: mapName
parameters.description: The name of the runtime map

post.summary: Updates selection XML of the given map

parameters.name: mapName
parameters.description: The name of the runtime map

get.summary: Gets the layers of the current selection set

parameters.name: mapName
parameters.description: The name of the runtime map

get.summary: Gets an overview of the current selection set with optional extent

parameters.name: mapName
parameters.description: The name of the runtime map

parameters.name: bounds
parameters.description: If true, includes the bounds of the whole selection

get.summary: Gets the features from the given layer in the selection set

parameters.name: mapName
parameters.description: The name of the runtime map

parameters.name: layerName
parameters.description: The name of the layer in the selection set

parameters.name: mappedonly
parameters.description: Only return properties mapped in the Layer Definition

parameters.name: transformto
parameters.description: The CS-Map coordinate system code to transform these features to

parameters.name: pagesize
parameters.description: Applies pagination on the query result. This specifies the number of results for the page.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Applies pagination on the query result. This specifies the page number of the page. You must specify a valid page size value (> 0) for this parameter to apply.

parameters.name: orientation
parameters.description: The display orientation of feature attribuutes. Only applies if type is html. h=horizontal, v=vertical

put.summary: Updates the map selection according to some spatial criteria

parameters.name: mapName
parameters.description: The name of the runtime map

parameters.name: layernames
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of layer names

parameters.name: geometry
parameters.description: The WKT of the intersecting geometry

parameters.name: maxfeatures
parameters.description: The maximum number features to select as a result of this operation

parameters.name: persist
parameters.description: If true, will cause this operation to modify the selection set

parameters.name: requestdata
parameters.description: A bitmask specifying the information to return in the response. 1=Attributes, 2=Inline Selection, 4=Tooltip, 8=Hyperlink

parameters.name: featurefilter
parameters.description: An XML selection string containing the required feature IDs

parameters.name: layerattributefilter
parameters.description: Bitmask value determining which layers will be queried. 1=Visible, 2=Selectable, 4=HasTooltips

parameters.name: selectionxml
parameters.description: Indicates if the 'featurefilter' parameter is to be treated as selection XML. Otherwise the input is treated as a SelectionUpdate XML document

parameters.name: append
parameters.description: Indicates if the this query selection indicated by the 'featurefilter' parameter should append to the current selection

post.summary: Creates the runtime map

parameters.name: mapName
parameters.description: The name of the runtime map

parameters.description: If true, this operation will simply pass through to the mapagent. This is much faster, but note that all network link URLs will be referring to the mapagent instead of downstream RESTful layer KML URLs.

get.summary: Gets the KML for the specified layer definition

parameters.name: bbox
parameters.description: A comma-separated quartet (x1,y1,x2,y2) defining the spatial filter geometry. Coordinates must be LL84 coordinates

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The display width of the KML viewport

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The display height of the KML viewport

parameters.name: draworder
parameters.description: The draw order of this layer

get.summary: Gets the features KML for the specified layer definition

parameters.name: bbox
parameters.description: A comma-separated quartet (x1,y1,x2,y2) defining the spatial filter geometry. Coordinates must be LL84 coordinates

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The display width of the KML viewport

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The display height of the KML viewport

parameters.name: draworder
parameters.description: The draw order of this layer

Gets the information of the current Site Server
Gets the version of the current Site Server
